events.comment: Here the rooms are generated, starting with a loop of 10 keys on a Dictionary (0,0;0,1;0,2;1,0,etc). Later will be used as an bi-dimentional Array

sub-events.comment: After every key is generated, the room-UID got attached to each key.
When player got to end of one direction, triggers a function. Arg0:playerX;Arg1:playerY;Arg2:Direction as string
This function doesn't really "generate" rooms, it detects where playing is moving (And if it can move here): Arg 0: PlayerX. Arg1: PlayerY. Arg2: String(up/down/left/right)
After the player exits the room, it shall be gone. It can't be destroyed: Just moves really really far away. No args required
When the player enters a new room, it gots tped to player
When the player enters a new room, it's painted on minimap. Arg0: redColor;Arg1:greenColor;Arg2:blueColor
Moves away every rock after player leaves the room
Moves away every rock after player leaves the room
Moves away every Enemy after player leaves the room
When the player enters a new room, every bullet mid-air gets destroyed. No args required
After a bullet is created, it's angle is decided. Arg0:Angle
Every tick check if it's on screen
If enemy has LOS to player (Ignoring stones) will folow it. Will also set the cone-of-vision to 360º
If enemy has NOT LOS to player, stops following and moves on a random direction
If enemy gets, someway, to the end of Pathfinding, will check it again. This is only for avoid possible future bugs
If enemy collides on a border or stone, will change the movement
